alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Central Phoenix; Deer Valley; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; New River Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Valley; Rio Verde, Salt River; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 13 at 1:44PM MST until February 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central Arizona. * WHEN...From 2 PM to 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Localized dense blowing dust with abrupt and dangerous restrictions to visibility will be possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
